description: This is the drive from Highway 99, south of Whistler, to the trailhead for the Ring Lake trail.Approx 12 kms past the Daisy Lake dam, turn left on the road to Callaghan Lake Provincial Park, Whistler Nordic Centre, etc....The first 10 kms are paved and beautiful. Just past Alexander Falls, turn left over the bridge and drive by the Callaghan Nordic Centre. It's 10 kms to this point. Here, reset your odometer to 0 and drive the forestry road leading to Callaghan Lake Prov Park 8.3 kms. You'll find parking at this point for approx 12 cars. This is the TH for the Ring Lake trail.See the GPS data and map.
directions: Drive north from Vancouver on Hway 99, past Squamish,  through the Cheakamus Canyon. From the dam at Daisy Lake, its approx 12 kms to the Callaghan Lake Prov Park / Whistler Nordic Centre turnoff on the left.
title: Ring Lake, The drive to the trailhead
